name: Europäische Akademie Bozen
goal:
EURAC was established in 1992 as a private non-profit organization for advanced research and further education, funded by both, private and public means. It has a turnover of about 33 million € and 391 collaborators. Its 11 institutes are active in 4 main sectors "Autonomies", "Health", "Mountains" and "Technologies".

EURAC is home to researchers from across Europe who work together on a wide range of interdisciplinary projects. Linguists, geneticists and experts in law and natural sciences collaborate with public and private agencies towards the resolution of some of the most central issues of our day. Together they contribute to the creation of a future-oriented Europe.

Service departments support researchers in dissemination of scientific results to scientific and public
community at local, national and international level.
Foster relations with international organisations, public and government offices, worldwide. Establish new institutional contacts, support and follow the participation of EURAC institutes in international projects and initiatives.
interests: Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Culture, Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
